column4: Hi.. Youtube doesnt work on Firefox, but on Opera it does.. (it says i should update my flash player)
in the firefox address bar type `plugins` and hit enter
that has all the downloads you need
thanks..i'll give it a shot
yup i see it now
ok, i dont know how to progress, could you be more specific?
it lists several plugins "Adobe Flash Player" for example is what you'll need to use youtube. Download that, close firefox, install it, reopen firefox
but the problem is, i did downloaded it, but that didn't help.. hours ago, i watched some videos and there was no problem.. it just happend after reboot
ah sorry, the default download isn't correct. there should be a link to alternate version so you can get a deb
technically the download you got works but you'd have to install it via command line, otherwise just download the deb version
on the adobe site is even a .deb for ubuntu 8.04+ but when i install it, it says you have allready a newer version installed
i've checked it in synaptic and the versions are the same, so no update is possible over .deb from adobe site or apt-get
type adding medibuntu repository and installing ubuntu-restricted-extras and w32codecs?
no change :(
could it be a firefox problem, cause in Opera the youtube is fine
try setting firefox as your default webbrowser and install the deb http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/otherversions/ again
ff is set as a default browser and the reinstall of flash plugin didnt helped

I don't see any reason your firefox shouldn't be working right now. I recommend purging firefox and deleting any leftover hidden mozilla stuff in your home folder. then reinstall firefox and add the flash deb while firefox isn't open
also, backup your bookmarks O_O
and passwords!
that too ^_^
i'll try that probably, cause i dont see a reason for it not working.. thanks anyway :)
